intro: Microthlaspi, commonly known as whitetop, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically annual or biennial herbs with small, white or pale yellow flowers. They are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and hairy stems. Microthlaspi species are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats. Their botanical features make them important in ecological studies and weed management.
